title: Did Amy Coney Barrett Say ‘Being Called the N-Word Does Not Constitute a Hostile Work Environment’?
subtitle: Barrett wrote for a unanimous three-judge panel in 2019 that upheld the dismissal of a workplace discrimination lawsuit by a Black employee who claimed he was called a racial slur by a supervisor.
author: David Mikkelson
vclaim: Judge Amy Coney Barrett, who was nominated to the U.S. Supreme Court in 2020, once declared that "being called the N-word does not constitute a hostile work environment."
